content.description: Blue Right can be conquered 3 ways. The first being a level of 5.8 if you take the crack to the left is known as Bat Crack. The second route-  Snake Ledge- the crack to the right is a 5.7. If you're looking for a harder challenge (5.9?), try tackling the bulge in the middle directly by starting on Snake Ledge and- instead of trending right- climb straight up the crack and throw almost blind for one of the myriad dirty pockets above you. Pull the few hard moves over the bulge and you'll be at the top in no time.
Climb the leftmost side of the rock face.

Left side offers a bouldering start with some decent finger pockets to pull through the first ten feet. eases up for a juggy finish. Starting at the vertical crack directly below the right anchor, traverse slightly right to finish on right anchor, or traverse left to finish below left anchor.
content.protection: top rope only.  two bomber eye-bolt anchors.  given their distance apart and away from top lip, using both creates too much rope drag.
content.location: park at Wingo Picnic Area. take path to cliff top. right at wooden overlook deck, and take trail 50-100 feet.  Anchors are 20 feet left off trail at top of cliff and easily identifiable.

content.description: The Blue area has three anchor points, and climbs range in difficulty from 5.5- 5.9 depending on where you setup your rope.
